On Tuesday 22 February 2005 14:07, Jeff Nielsen wrote:
> "Michael Schuerig" <michael@...> wrote:

> > I went with the simplest thing that works, i.e., stuffing the
> > script file's entire contents into Statement#execute().
>
> A couple of the things you get from the Ant code that you don't get
> from passing the whole thing to Statement.execute() are:
>
> - Ability to continue on error, even if one (or more) of the
> statements doesn't execute properly

But they have to execute properly...

> - Ability to have comments in your script starting with "//" or "--"
>
> - More flexibility with delimiters (EOL or ;)
>
> - Good logging to let you know which statements had problems

With HSQLDB I have all this except for the delimiters.

> - Control over when the commit happens

The decorator has a setter for autoCommit.

I don't need a general, highly parameterizable solution. Have a look at 
the code and see how simple it is. If I need anything more involved, 
I'll surely use the Ant stuff. For the time being it's simplicity I'm 
after.

Michael
